title.rendered: BUET teachers received a grant of Tk 2 crore in the research sector

content.rendered:
Dhaka University (DU): Teachers of Bangladesh University of Engineering (BUET) have been given a grant of Tk 2 crore to showcase innovative research projects and enhance collaboration with industry.

The donation was given at a function organized in the seminar room of ECE building of BUET on Saturday (February 17) afternoon.The program titled ‘Internal Research Grants and Research Exhibition’ is organized by BUET’s Research and Innovation Center for Science and Engineering (RISE).

University Vice-Chancellor Professor Dr. Mr. Satya Prasad Majumdar, chief coordinator of SDG issues of the Prime Minister’s Office was also present. Akhtar Hossain, Managing Director of Bangladesh Hi-Tech Park Authority GSM Zafarullah, Member of Bangladesh University Grant Commission Professor Dr. Hasina Khan, Managing Director of DBL Group Mr. M. A. Jabbar Director of RISE Prof. Dr. welcomed the event. Muhammad Anisuzzaman Talukdar.

Mechanical Engineering Department and Civil Engineering Department, Mechanical Engineering Department Professor Dr. Md. Ehsan, Director of RISE Professor Dr. Muhammad Anisuzzaman Talukdar was awarded the crest.

In addition, the Institute of Water and Flood Management (IWFM) and Chemical Engineering Department, IWFM Professor Dr. A.K.M. Saiful Islam and Professor Dr. Mushfiqus Salehin was awarded the crest.

Notably, BUET invites research proposals from faculty in 2023 through RISE. It contains 29 research proposals. From there, 12 projects that are timely and helpful in dealing with the fourth industrial revolution are selected and financed. At least one undergraduate or postgraduate student will work as a research assistant in these 12 projects.

Deans of all departments of BUET, directors of various departments, heads of departments, senior officials of various industrial institutions, students and dignitaries were present in the ceremony.

Bangladesh Time: 0142 hrs, February 18, 2024
